thread.title: UPDATE 2-Peru cenbank raises interest rate for first time in 4 yrs
thread.title_full: UPDATE 2-Peru cenbank raises interest rate for first time in 4 yrs | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: UPDATE 2-Peru cenbank raises interest rate for first time in 4 yrs
text:
(Adds context, comment from central bank and analyst)
LIMA, Sept 10 (Reuters) - Peru's central bank unexpectedly hiked its benchmark interest rate for the first time in four years on Thursday to tame above-target inflation, and said there was scope for further increases.
The 25-basis-point hike to 3.50 percent was forecast by only three out of 14 analysts polled by Reuters this week.
The central bank said it still considered the higher rate expansive, and that it could raise it again to bring inflation back into its 1 percent-to-3 percent target range.
"The interest rate's new level is equivalent to a real interest rate of 0.5 percent," the bank said in a statement.
However, it said its decision did not necessarily mark the start of a series of hikes.
Peru's rate increase comes amid continued uncertainty over whether the U.S. Federal Reserve will raise interest rates at a Sept. 16-17 meeting.
Expectations for tighter monetary policy in the United States have fueled the sol's nearly 8 percent slide against the dollar this year, helping push inflation to 4 percent in August - the first time it has been a full percentage point above the central bank's 3 percent target ceiling since 2012.
The central bank has fought to soften the sol's losses with heavy interventions in the local spot markets and tighter limits on currency derivative operations.
"The (interest rate) decision is clearly a response to both the increase in the inflation expectations and the pressure the currency has been suffering," said 4Cast analyst Pedro Tuesta, who had forecast the rate hike and expects another in December.
The central bank sounded slightly more optimistic on the economy's recovery from its worst slowdown in four years.
"It is estimated that the economy will likely grow at a rate similar to GDP's potential rate in 2016," the central bank said.
The monetary authority said in February that it saw Peru's potential growth rate at about 5 percent. (Reporting by Lima Newsroom; Editing by Richard Lough , Lisa Shumaker and Ken Wills )
